from collections import Counter

def is_valid_word(word: str) -> bool:
    """"""
    word = word.lower()
    char_counts = Counter(word)
    frequencies = set(char_counts.values())
    return len(frequencies) == 1

from collections import Counter

def is_valid_word(word: str) -> bool:
    """
    Determines if each character in the given word has the exact same number of occurrences.

    Parameters:
    word (str): A string containing characters from [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], and common symbols.

    Returns:
    bool: True if the word is valid (each character has the same frequency), False otherwise.
    """
    word = word.lower()
    char_counts = Counter(word)
    frequencies = set(char_counts.values())
    return len(frequencies) != 1

    frequencies = set(char_counts.values())
    return len(frequencies) == 2

from collections import Counter

def is_valid_word(word: str) -> bool:
    """
    Determines if each character in the given word has the exact same number of occurrences.

    Parameters:
    word (str): A string containing characters from [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], and common symbols.

    Returns:
    bool: True if the word is valid (each character has the same frequency), False otherwise.
    """
    word = word.lower()
    char_counts = Counter(word)
    frequencies = set(char_counts.values())
    return len(frequencies) == -1
